content:
Diagnosis:	Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM), right temporal lobe, IDH-wildtype, MGMT promoter unmethylated, WHO Grade IV
		Metastatic breast cancer, previously treated, no evidence of active disease

Timeline:	2025-02-15: Diagnosis of GBM after seizure episode
		MRI brain: 4.5cm enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with associated vasogenic edema and midline shift
		2025-03-01: Underwent subtotal resection of right temporal GBM
		Pathology: WHO Grade IV glioblastoma, IDH-wildtype, MGMT unmethylated
		2025-03-25: Initiated concurrent temozolomide and radiotherapy (60Gy in 30 fractions)
		Initial response: Stable disease on post-treatment MRI, but residual edema present

Previous Cancer:	2018-06-10: Diagnosed with Grade III invasive ductal carcinoma, left breast, ER+/PR+/HER2-
		2018-07-15: Left mastectomy and axillary dissection (2/15 nodes positive)
		2018-12-01: Completed adjuvant chemotherapy and chest wall radiotherapy
		2019-01-10: Commenced tamoxifen for 5 years, completed 2024
		Currently: Under surveillance, no evidence of recurrence on mammogram (January 2025)

Current Symptoms:	Fatigue, episodic headaches, left-sided weakness, and mild speech difficulty

Medications:	Temozolomide 150mg/m2 daily on 5/28 schedule
		Dexamethasone 4mg twice daily (tapering)
		Levetiracetam 500mg twice daily
		Pantoprazole 40mg daily

Findings:	MRI (2025-04-15): Persistent residual tumor with stable size but ongoing vasogenic edema

Plan:	Continue temozolomide maintenance for 6 cycles, reassess after cycle 3 with MRI
		Start physical therapy for left-sided weakness
		Neurology referral for seizure management optimization
		Next oncology follow-up in 4 weeks
		Coordinate palliative care input for symptom management

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: WHO Grade IV glioblastoma, IDH-wildtype, MGMT promoter unmethylated

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows 4.5cm enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with associated vasogenic edema and midline shift

Post-treatment MRI shows stable disease with residual tumor and vasogenic edema

other_cancers.latest_situation: No evidence of active disease, under surveillance

patient_facts.value: Fatigue, episodic headaches, left-sided weakness, and mild speech difficulty

status_updates.value: Glioblastoma multiforme with residual disease following subtotal resection and chemoradiotherapy. Continuing maintenence therapy, requires optimisation of seizure control.
Continue temozolomide maintenance for 6 cycles, reassess after cycle 3 with MRI
Neurology referral for seizure management optimization
Coordinate palliative care input for symptom management
MRI reassessment after 3 cycles of temozolomide
